content:
PASA Western Region Events http://www.pasafarming.org Upcoming events in the western region of Pennsylvania - Allegheny, Armstrong, Beaver, Butler, Clarion, Crawford, Erie, Fayette, Forest, Greene, Indiana, Jefferson, Lawrence, Mercer, Somerset, Venango, Warren, Washington, and Westmoreland counties. daily 1 2012-01-06T19:12:45Z Sustainability School - Shittake Mushroom Intensive http://www.pasafarming.org/events/pasa-events/sustainability-school-shittake-mushroom-intensive Applications Due: April 15, 2013

Download the registration form

Location: Quiet Creek Herb Farm & School of Country Living, 93 Quiet Creek Lane Brookville, PA

Description: Shiitake Mushroom Intensive, April 12-14, starts 3 p.m. and ends 3 p.m.

Overview of the Weekend
Expectations & What to Pack\ufffd\ufffd
Detailed Itinerary

Discover the key concepts of growing, harvesting, preserving, and cooking Shiitake and Oyster Mushrooms, as well as using them for medicine. For seventeen years, Quiet Creek Herb Farm & School of Country Living has been offering workshops on sustainable living \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd mushrooms are an exciting part of our mission.\ufffd\ufffd

Claire and Rusty Orner, owners and stewards of Quiet Creek (a non-profit farm), will incorporate Quiet Creek\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds model by teaching you how to master your mushroom passion to benefit your diet and health. The theory of mushroom growing, harvesting, preserving, cooking, and\ufffd\ufffd medicinal use will be applied in hands-on classes which will stimulate your intellect, your taste buds, and your do-it-yourself knowhow. In addition to formal classes, the following optional activities are available for those interested: mountain biking (bikes & helmets provided), hiking, journaling, Sunday worship, and a community music circle (feel free to bring your own instruments!)

Over the weekend, you will enjoy a unique immersion experience as you absorb all the beauty and knowledge that Quiet Creek has to offer. Quiet Creek is an alcohol and smoke free environment with lodging that is rustic and primitive; accommodations on the farm will be based upon registration numbers and may include a yurt, a renovated barn, and/or tents. Delicious, locally and sustainably raised meals will be provided throughout the three days, and food preferences will be honored. All energy needed for the weekend will be produced on site with the solar array and wind turbine, and all waste produced on site will be composted!

Cost:\ufffd\ufffd $275 which includes three relaxing days and two nights with practical experience and knowledge to put Shiitake and Oyster mushrooming at your location, take home goodies, 6 whole food meals, and creative lodging. Please note that we will offer PASA members a $20 discount on registration. Attention: This workshop is limited to 20 students, so sign up early.

Applications Due: April 15, 2013 - Download the registration form


PASA partners with organizations, groups and individuals to bring you ongoing programming centered around homesteading, homemaking and backyard conservation. Our Sustainability School partners coordinate the events and registration, please follow the link for more information and to register.

]]> No publisher Michele Spencer 2013-01-18T15:40:00Z Event PASA Western Region - End of Year Potluck http://www.pasafarming.org/events/pasa-events/pasa-western-region-end-of-year-potluck Eden Hall Campus\ufffd\ufffdof Chatham University
6035 Ridge Road, Richland Township, PA 15044
PLEASE RSVP HERE.

Please bring a dish to share!
Come share a warm winter meal, community and conversation.

Bring a friend to share in the festivities and learn more about PASA! Our potluck celebrations are a great time to connect with others in the region who care about sustainable food and farming, learn more about PASA's work and share your ideas for the coming months.

PLEASE RSVP HERE.

\ufffd\ufffd

If you have the time, please considering coming early to participate in our focus group!
PASA is working to evaluate our communication strategies - our websites, newsletters, blogs, emails and social media - to understand how we can serve our members better and involve new people in our community. As part of this process, we are gathering in-depth input from members and non-members alike to get an accurate picture of our current efforts - what works, what doesn't and what is missing.

Please click here to to learn more, select a focus group to attend & RSVP.

Each focus group will last between 90 minutes to a maximum of 2 hours. The discussion will be held in a small group, no more than 8 people, to encourage a lively and productive conversation. The entire process will be extremely informal, think of it as a talk with friends!

All focus group participants will be entered to win a PASA Gift Basket loaded with PASA-themed gear & some local food treats. Refreshments and a light snack will also be offered during the focus group.

]]> No publisher Michele Spencer 2013-11-07T15:35:00Z Event Sustainability School - Planning & Planting a Garden of Your Own http://www.pasafarming.org/events/pasa-events/sustainability-school-planning-planting-a-garden-of-your-own Jennings Environmental Education Center
2951 Prospect Rd, Slippery Rock PA 16057

Here\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds an opportunity for those who want to grow some of their own herbs and vegetables, but might not know where to start, as well as for anyone who wants to refine their gardening skills or gain new perspectives.\ufffd\ufffd

Sonja Hunt from Restoration Herbs in Franklin, PA, will facilitate this workshop, which will focus on the process of determining where, what and how to plant. Participants will use a pre-workshop questionnaire to consider their own potential garden site, needs and capabilities.\ufffd\ufffd Then, following an overview of the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdwhys and hows\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd of organic gardening, they will sketch out a plan, and learn about choosing and sourcing seeds and plants. The workshop is recommended for ages 16 and up.

Pre-registration and pre-payment of $10.00* per person are required by February 9th.\ufffd\ufffd *Registration fee for PASA/GFN members is $8.00

Register online at http://www.dcnr.state.pa.us/Calendar/list.asp or call Jennings at 724-794-6011.

PASA partners with organizations, groups and individuals to bring you ongoing programming centered around homesteading, homemaking and backyard conservation. Our Sustainability School partners coordinate the events and registration, please follow the link for more information and to register.

]]> No publisher Michele Spencer 2012-12-10T19:20:00Z Event Western Region Event: Building Healthy Organic Soil for Your Vegetable Garden http://www.pasafarming.org/events/pasa-events/western-region-event-building-healthy-organic-soil-for-your-vegetable-garden Farmer and PASA member Chris Brittenburg of Who Cooks for You Farm and Nicole Kubiczki offer relatively easy and practical\ufffd\ufffdapproaches to home garden soil management. This workshop will help you understand the basics of soil composition and what you need to start building healthy, robust soil for growing nutrient-dense organic vegetables at home. Nicole Kubiczki, former CSA manager at Who Cooks For You Farm and previous volunteer garden educator for Grow Pittsburgh, will also share some basics to backyard composting.

\ufffd\ufffd

Although this event is free, a suggested $10 donation will be accepted by PASA.

To register, call the East End Food Co-op at\ufffd\ufffd412-242-3598 to reserve your spot!

]]> No publisher leah@pasafarming.org 2014-02-13T18:30:00Z Event Sustainability School - Preserving the Season http://www.pasafarming.org/events/pasa-events/sustainability-school-preserving-the-season East End Food Co-op
(In the Gemini Children's Theater)
7516 Meade Street
Pittsburgh, PA 15208

PASA members Susanna Meyer, author of Saving the Seasons: How to Can, Freeze, or Dry Almost Anything, and Danielle Marvit of the Pittsburgh Canning Exchange will introduce you to simple and fun ways to preserve seasonal specialties. Learn how to freeze and dry herbs, prepare a quick batch of refrigerator pickles, and make a fail-proof water bath processed jam. The presenters will share samples of easy and delicious recipes that you can use at home to help you enjoy local foods all year long! There will also be plenty of time for questions. Although this event is free, a suggested $10 donation will be accepted by PASA.

This event is FREE; just the East End Food Co-op at 412-242-3598 to reserve your spot!

]]> No publisher leah@pasafarming.org 2014-08-25T15:35:00Z Event Western Region Event - Organic Blueberry Production on a Diversified Farm http://www.pasafarming.org/events/pasa-events/organic-blueberry-production-on-a-diversified-farm

Hunter Farms
7269 Sterrettania Road
Fairview, PA 16414

$10 PASA Members
$15 Non-Members

Register Here

Hunter Farms has been a producer of certified organic blueberries since 1995. The farm has over six acres planted in blueberries with a total of about five thousand plants. This class will cover all aspects of blueberry production including site preparation, cultivar selection, trimming techniques, field sanitation, pest and disease control, harvesting, and marketing.

In addition to the blueberry crop the farm also operates a CSA, a farm market and produces the Fresh Little Farm Girl line of soaps and body care products. A portion of the class will be devoted to the value of farm diversification and the integration of a single major crop into the mix of products and services offered.

Lunch and refreshments will be provided.

Hunter Farms is located just a few miles from the intersection of I-90 and I-79.

]]> No publisher leah@pasafarming.org 2014-04-15T18:30:00Z Event Ways to Give: Local Food Bash at the Supper Club http://www.pasafarming.org/events/partner-events/ways-to-give-local-food-bash-at-the-supper-club

Call\ufffd\ufffd724-691-0536 to purchase tickets!

Join The Supper Club Chef Greg Andrews and his team \ufffd\ufffdshowcase the best locally grown and produced food our area has to offer while we give back and help the local farming community.

Enjoy samples from local farmers, distributors & purveyors.

Part of the proceeds from this event will be donated to the Arias M. Brownback Memorial Scholarship Fund. This memorial fund is intended to inspire and aid young farmers to reach their full potential. This endowment is designed to help youth and other developing farmers attend the Farming for the Future Conference. The scholarship expresses the Pennsylvania Association for Sustainable Agriculture (PASA) commitment to providing educational opportunities for those wishing to learn sustainable agriculture techniques and methods regardless of financial circumstances

By purchasing a ticket and attending this event you will have the opportunity to win awesome prizes consisting of local food and much more!

]]> No publisher leah@pasafarming.org 2013-09-11T15:50:00Z Event Pittsburgh Day of Giving http://www.pasafarming.org/events/pasa-events/pittsburgh-day-of-giving-2 Anyone, anywhere can donate to PASA through Pittsburgh Gives, an online giving event that benefits nonprofits in Allegheny, Butler and Westmoreland counties.

On Tuesday, May 6th from 6:00am- Midnight, a portion of your donation to PASA through Pittsburgh Gives will be matched by the Pittsburgh Foundation.

Boost your giving power and donate to PASA!

Last year's event raised $2,895. With your support, we hope to raise even more! Help PASA's work to bring farmers together to learn from each other, and to build relationships between those farmers and consumers looking for fresh, wholesome, locally and sustainably produced food.

\ufffd\ufffd

\ufffd\ufffd

Your donation supports PASA\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds farmer education, which keeps our family farms and local food economies strong.

\ufffd\ufffd

]]> No publisher leah@pasafarming.org 2014-01-13T15:15:00Z Event PASA / FMC Webinar - Your Edge in a Changing Marketplace: Thinking like a Retailer http://www.pasafarming.org/events/pasa-events/pasa-fmc-webinar-your-edge-in-a-changing-marketplace-thinking-like-a-retailer This webinar is the 3rd in a series planned through a joint partnership between Pennsylvania Association for Sustainable Agriculture and the Farmers Market Coalition, supported by a USDA Farmers Market Promotion Program grant. \ufffd\ufffdThese webinars are free for Farmers Market Coalition members as well as all farmers markets and vendors in Pennsylvania.

Farmers markets are no longer the only option for shoppers seeking locally grown foods. Is your markets\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd brand, products, and shopping experience keeping pace with an evolving marketplace? Learn about savvy retailer strategies to understand and promote your best assets and make your customers feel special.\ufffd\ufffd This session will offer a variety of strategies to help put your market in the spotlight and grow customer loyalty to keep you on the cutting edge of the changing local food landscape.

Presenter: Eric Barrett, Ohio State University Extension
Moderator: Brian Moyer, Penn State Extension

Register Now!

]]> No publisher Michele Spencer 2014-01-13T15:35:00Z Event PASA Western Region - Film Screening http://www.pasafarming.org/events/pasa-events/film-screening-fresh-2

Tuesday, September 25th
Ford City Public Library
1136 4th Avenue\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdFord City, PA 16226

Screenings at 2:00pm and 8:00pm

FRESH, celebrates the farmers, thinkers and business people across America who are re-inventing our food system. Each has witnessed the rapid transformation of our agriculture into an industrial model, and confronted the consequences: food contamination, environmental pollution, depletion of natural resources, and morbid obesity. Forging healthier, sustainable alternatives, they offer a practical vision for a future of our food and our planet.

Among several main characters, FRESH features urban farmer and activist, Will Allen, the recipient of MacArthur\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds 2008 Genius Award; sustainable farmer and entrepreneur, Joel Salatin, made famous by Michael Pollan\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds book, The Omnivore\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Dilemma; and supermarket owner, David Ball, challenging our Wal-Mart dominated economy.

Read More freshthemovie.com

]]> No publisher leah@pasafarming.org 2012-09-07T15:45:00Z Event PASA's 3rd Annual Dairy Dash 5K & Memory Walk http://www.pasafarming.org/events/pasa-events/pasas-3rd-annual-dairy-dash-5k-memory-walk Lambs Creek Recreation Area
Mansfield, PA


All proceeds from the Dairy Dash will support the Shon Seeley Legacy Fund for Sustainable Farming Education. This fund\ufffd\ufffdhonors the life and memory of Shon Seeley, a PASA member who lost his life in 2012, through support of educational programming specific to the farming principles held dearly by him: livestock grazing, sustainable beef & dairy production, value-added dairy processing, livestock genetic preservation, and native pasture grass management & weed identification.

Dairy Dash Details

The 3.1-mile loop Cross Country Trail Course is NCAA Certified and part of the beautiful Lambs Creek Recreation Area, administered by the Army Corps of Engineers, Baltimore District.

  • Register by August 21 to receive our souvenir organic t-shirt.
  • The 5K Fun Run will be chip-timed.
  • Real time race results can be provided to runners via Facebook, Twitter, or text.
  • The 1-Mile Memory Walk starts after the 5K step-off, and will not be timed.
  • Water stop provided & refreshments will be served after the race, including Milky Way Farms delicious chocolate milk!
  • Runners & walkers only on the course please. Strollers and baby joggers welcome; bicycles, skates and pets will not be permitted.
  • Ample free parking is available. Parking is conveniently located close to the registration area.
  • Race # and T-shirt pick-up runs from 7:15-8:30 AM.
  • Walk-in registrations welcome until 8:30 AM on race day. All participants will be required to sign a waiver on race day prior to running/walking this event, or you will not be allowed to participate. Participants under age 18 must have their parent/legal guardian sign for them.

Prizes

  • Awards will be given to the 5K\ufffd\ufffd1st Place Overall Finishers, Male & Female
  • Age Group Awards:

1st, 2nd, 3rd, Male & Female
15 and under, 16-19, 20-29 and 10-year increments up to 70+

Registration

You may easily register online.

  • $18 \ufffd\ufffdEarly Bird Registration through March 20, 2015
  • $20 \ufffd\ufffdPre-Registration through August 21, 2015
    This is the last registration date to be guaranteed a t-shirt on race day.
  • $25 Final Registration through August 31, 2015
  • $35 \ufffd\ufffdAfter August 31 and on Race Day

\ufffd\ufffd

\ufffd\ufffd

\ufffd\ufffd

Don't want to register online?

Download the race flyer here to fill in and mail to PASA at:

PASA Dairy Dash
PO Box 419
Millheim, PA 16854

Last Year's Photos

View the beautiful course and excitement from last year's event here!

MAKE THE MOST OF YOUR VISIT TO THE NORTHERN TIER!

Recreational & Local Food Resources

Northern Tier Cultural Alliance
Northern Tier Local Food Guide
Pennsylvania Grand Canyon
Pennsylvania Lumber Museum
Tioga County Visitors Bureau
Endless Mountains Visitors Bureau

\ufffd\ufffd

DIRECTIONS TO LAMBS CREEK RECREATION AREA

From the North: Route 15 South, First Mansfield exit, turn right at the Lamb\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Creek Recreation Area signs.

From the South: Route 15 North, Second Mansfield exit on to Route 6. Follow Route 6 East into Mansfield.\ufffd\ufffd At the Main Street stop light (second stop light), turn left onto North Main Street.\ufffd\ufffd Head out of town and bear to the left under the overpass. Follow signs to Lamb\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Creek Recreation Area.

From the West: Route 6 East into Mansfield.\ufffd\ufffd At the Main Street stop light (second stop light), turn left onto North Main Street.\ufffd\ufffd Head out of town and bear to the left under the overpass. Follow signs to Lamb\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Creek Recreation Area.

From the East: Route 6 West into Mansfield.\ufffd\ufffd At the Main Street stop light, turn right onto North Main Street.\ufffd\ufffd Head out of town and bear to the left under the overpass. Follow signs to Lamb\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Creek Recreation Area.

SPONSORSHIP OPPORTUNITIES

We have many levels of support available to promote your business, service or group.
Download sponsorship information here.

FOR ADDITIONAL RACE INFO OR QUESTIONS

Contact Jaunette Matis at PASA, 814-349-9856, or jaunette@pasafarming.org.

]]> No publisher Michele Spencer 2014-01-30T15:45:00Z Event PASA Western Region Master Class - Raising and Processing Pastured Poultry for Home and Market http://www.pasafarming.org/events/pasa-events/western-region-master-class-raising-and-processing-pastured-poultry-for-home-and-market

Dreese Family Farm
14067 Higby Hill Road
Townville, PA 16360
Crawford County

Cost: $10 PASA Members, $15.00 Non-Members

Pre-registration required. Register online here or call 412-365-2985.

Have you wanted to try raising pastured poultry?\ufffd\ufffd Maybe you are currently raising your own and would like to fine tune your operation?\ufffd\ufffd Or maybe you just want to make new connections with like minded people in your area that believe in sustainable agriculture?

Join Justin and Maria Dreese at their home in Crawford County for a pastured poultry workshop.\ufffd\ufffd Guest speakers will include Jeff Mattocks, Vice President and Nutritionist for the Fertrell Company and Eli Reiff, the Poultry Man from Mifflinburg, PA.

The workshop will provide a hands-on demonstration of poultry processing instructed by Eli.\ufffd\ufffd Jeff Mattocks will cover topics including nutrition and housing.\ufffd\ufffd For this workshop a feed trial is being conducted.\ufffd\ufffd Jeff will discuss the differences between feed rations and the affects nutrition has on animal health and taste.\ufffd\ufffd A blind taste test will be offered of the pastured poultry to include in the trial results.

A picnic lunch will be offered.\ufffd\ufffd Please plan accordingly if dietary restrictions apply.

Agenda
10:00 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Welcome & Introductions
10:15-12:30 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Processing Demonstration & Hands-on Participation
12:30 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Lunch
1:30 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 3:30 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Housing, Nutrition & Feed Trial Results
3:30 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 4:00 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Blind Taste Test, Q&A

For directions or questions about the workshop please contact Justin and Maria at 814-720-2749.

Special thanks to the Mattocks Five, serving 5 locations (Meadville Farm & Garden, Albion Mill and 5M Feed Waterford, Titusville, and Warren locations) for providing feed for the trial.

Justin and Maria have raised Jumbo Cornish Cross Rocks for the past few years.\ufffd\ufffd This year they will be processing approximately 110 birds.\ufffd\ufffd Half of the birds are sold locally and half are kept for their family.\ufffd\ufffd They also keep egg layers, and this year they are trying two breeds of dual purpose ducks \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Khaki Campbell and White Pekin.\ufffd\ufffd This will also be their second year for raising pastured pork.

]]> No publisher leah@pasafarming.org 2013-04-26T19:20:00Z Event Western PA Buy Fresh Buy Local\ufffd\ufffd - Harvest for the Hungry Farmers Market Events http://www.pasafarming.org/events/pasa-events/local-food-month-harvest-for-the-hungry-farmers-market-events-1 September is Local Food Month & Hunger Action Month
Share the Harvest with PASA and The Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank

Shop at a local farmers' markets and donate fresh healthy produce to those in need!

What is Harvest for the Hungry?
Harvest for the Hungry is a fun, charitable event that gives farmers market customers an opportunity to support their local farmers while giving back to families in need. \ufffd\ufffdAt your market, during the week of September 23, purchase an extra bag of produce from your favorite market vendors, and drop it off with volunteers at the market, who will donate it to a local food pantry!
Saturday, September 21
Slippery Rock Community Farmers Market, Slippery Rock
Farmers at the Firehouse, Strip District, Pittsburgh
Somerset County Farmers' Market, Somerset, PA
Monday, September 23
CitiParks East Liberty Farmers Market, Pittsburgh
Friday, September 27
CitiParks Northside Farmers Market, Pittsburgh

]]> No publisher Michele Spencer 2014-07-14T19:45:00Z Event Western PA Buy Fresh Buy Local\ufffd\ufffd - Local Food Month http://www.pasafarming.org/events/pasa-events/western-pa-buy-fresh-buy-local-r-local-food-month

September is Local Food Month in Western Pennsylvania

\ufffd\ufffd

Celebrate local flavor at its peak all month long with the Western Pennsylvania Buy Fresh Buy Local\ufffd\ufffd Chapter!

Local Food Month highlights the bounty of good food found right here in our own neighborhoods. Learn more about where your food comes from, how it was produced, and who produced and prepared it. \ufffd\ufffdFind ways to give back to support local farming and healthy local food for all!

2014 Local Food Month Events

Preserving the Season

September 10
East End Food Co-op
Pittsburgh, PA/ Allegheny County\ufffd\ufffd

Learn how to freeze and dry herbs, prepare a quick batch of refrigerator pickles, and make a fail-proof water bath processed jam.

The Mother Earth News Fair
September 12-14
Seven Springs Mountain Resort
Seven Spring, PA/ Somerset Co.

Visit PASA's Stage and Information Booth to learn from regional experts and local farmers!

Harvest for the Hungry
September 15-20
Farmers Markets in Western Pennsylvania

PASA and the Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank partner with farmers markets around the region. \ufffd\ufffdBuy extra produce from a farmer at your favorite market and donate it to a local food pantry. \ufffd\ufffdFind a participating market here.

Local Foods Month Sampling Session at the East End Food Co-op
September 24
East End Food Co-op
Pittsburgh, PA / Allegheny County

A chance to meet the suppliers of some of your favorite local products, and sample offerings from Clarion River Organics, Healcrest Urban Farm, Cherish Creamery, Pastitio, and many more. Don\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt miss this tasting adventure!

The Supper Club's Annual Local Food Bash
September 25
The Supper Club at The Greensburg Train Station
Greensburg, PA/ Westmoreland Co.

The Supper Club at the Greensburg Train Station celebrates with local food stations, raffles, and give-aways, with proceeds benefiting local farmers & PASA's Arias M. Brownback Memorial Scholarship Fund.

Meadville Market House Local Foods Dinner
September 26
Allegheny College, Schultz Banquet Center
Meadville, PA / Crawford Co.

The Meadville Market Authority is hosting a benefit evening of fine dining and music. The Dinner features locally grown fruits and vegetables as well as local meats, breads and cheeses provided by our Market House vendors and prepared by Chef Charles Wise. \ufffd\ufffdLocally brewed beer and wine will also be served. Dinner guests will be entertained by internationally acclaimed pianist Beth Etter performing classical music. Tickets are $50.00 each and are available at the Market House.Contact Alice Sjolander 814-336-2056.
